sentence.text: A genetically determined generalized hyperexcitability had been predicted in primarily generalized seizures, but surprisingly the first epilepsy gene discovered, response to hypoxia, was in a focal (frontal negative regulation of protein kinase activity)-onset syndrome.

entity.text: negative regulation of protein kinase activity

sentence.text: The reason why response to hypoxia causes focal-onset seizures is unknown.
Recently, the second focal (temporal negative regulation of protein kinase activity)-onset epilepsy gene, axon guidance (unknown function), was discovered.

entity.text: negative regulation of protein kinase activity

sentence.text: response to hypoxia led the way to mutation identifications in 15 ion channel genes, most causing primarily generalized epilepsies.

Mutations in the mitotic cytokinesis gene (unknown function) occur in other rare JME families, and yet in other families, associations are present between JME (or other generalized epilepsies) and single nucleotide polymorphisms in the regulation of transcription by RNA polymerase II gene (unknown function) and the malic enzyme 2 (ME2) gene.

entity.text: regulation of transcription by RNA polymerase II
